rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment provides factual description of cases/symptoms ('have been reported', 'developed pink eye', 'had mild respiratory symptoms') without high-potency framing.
The verb 'have been reported' is not a moderate verb.
No loaded rhetorical question is present in the text.
The segment reports facts about cases/symptoms but does not contain explicit calming language.
The segment does not contain a minimiser used in conjunction with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
Reports factual details about cases and symptoms.
Reports the numerical metric 'Three previous cases of human infection' using the standard verb 'reported'.
